13403373.caption: Visit
13403373.keywords: ​Everything you need to know before visiting the museum
13403373.introHtml:
VISIT

Immerse yourself in two million years of human history art and culture

properties.html:
VISIT

Immerse yourself in two million years of human history art and culture

Everything you need to know before visiting the museum

Opening Hours


The museum is open today from 9:00 AM to 6:00 PM

9:00 AMTO6:00 PMMonday, Wednesday, Thursday, Saturday and Sunday

9:00 AMTO9:45 PMFriday

CLOSEDTuesday

See opening hours of museum 

Ticket Prices

Entrance fees
Tickets purchased online€17
Tickets purchased at the museum
Limited number available during off-peak times.€15
Under 18 year olds, under 26 year old residents of the EEA
See full list of visitors eligible for free admission FREE
Are you coming in a group (7 or more people) ?
See group prices

visitors List eligible for free admission 

MAP, ENTRANCES & DIRECTIONS

Tips for finding your way around the Louvre.

Find your way around the Louvre 

Schedule of room closures

The Louvre is carrying out some major maintenance and renovation work to make the visitor experience as comfortable and positive as possible. As a result, some of the museum rooms have to be periodically closed. In addition, some rooms may need to be closed for weather-related reasons. For further information, please contact us on +33 (0)1 40 20 53 17.

See list of available galleries

170703655.caption: Tickets
170703655.introHtml:
Welcome to the Louvre's official online sales site

We strongly advise all visitors to book a time slot in advance to guarantee their admission to the museum in case of overcrowding.
To prepare your visit, please click here  to check our schedule of room closures

EXHIBITIONS :
The price of entry to the exhibitions is included with a museum entry ticket.
- « Naples à Paris. Le Louvre invite le musée de Capodimonte.  » jusqu'au au 8 janvier 2024.
CLOSURE OF THE SALLE DE LA CHAPPELLE (Part 2 of the exhibition) - for more information, click here .
- « The Treasury of Notre-Dame Cathedral: from its Origins to Viollet-le-Duc  » (open until 29 January 2024).
Please note, however, that visitors are required to reserve a free time slot  in order to enter the exhibition.
- « Claude Gillot »
CLOSURE INFORMATION FOR THIS EXHIBITION - for more information, click here

246152670.introHtml:
Louvre

ESCAPE WITH THE LOUVRE

Exhibition

01 Nov 2023 - 04 Dec 2023

Guided Tours

10 Dec 2023 - 06 Jan 2024

Event

10 Jan 2024 - 06 feb 2024

Exhibition

10 feb 2024 - 27 feb 2024

properties.html:
Louvre

ESCAPE WITH THE LOUVRE

Exhibition

01 Nov 2023 - 04 Dec 2023

Guided Tours

10 Dec 2023 - 06 Jan 2024

Event

10 Jan 2024 - 06 feb 2024

Exhibition

10 feb 2024 - 27 feb 2024

Book Tickets

WELCOME TO THE LOUVRE


There are plenty of good reasons to visit the Louvre! So many works of art to discover in this fabulous museum that used to be a palace! So plan your visit in advance to make the most of it. Why not pick one of our visitor trails to follow a theme-based tour? And when you need a break, where better than the museum’s restful gardens?

DELVE INTO THE LOUVRE

Become a Member
Sign up to our newsletters

848007945.caption: Support Us
848007945.introHtml:
Help and Support the Louvre 

Individuals, companies or foundations

properties.html:
Help and Support the Louvre 

Individuals, companies or foundations

HOW TO MAKE A DONATION 

Sample text. Click to select the text box. Click again or double click to start ​In just a few clicks, you can make an online donation via the museum’s secure platform. You can choose to put your donation toward one of the following activities: conserving and preserving the collections, art and cultural education, reaching and accommodating new types of visitors, the museum’s most pressing needs, or the greening of the Tuileries Garden. During a Become a Patron!  campaign, all donations are put toward the outlined project. 

A TAX BREAK (FRENCH RESIDENTS ONLY)

Sample text. Click to select the text box. Click again or double click to staNo matter the amount of your donation, you can deduct 66% from your taxable income (up to 20% of total taxable revenues). For example, a donation of €100 costs, in reality, €34, allowing you to deduct €66 from your taxable income. If this reduction exceeds 20% of your taxable income, the remainder can be carried over for the following five years.rt editing the text. Excepteur sint occaecat cupidatat non proident, sunt in culpa qui officia deserunt mollit anim id est laborum.

MAKE YOUR DONATION

Donation Form

2374130771.caption: Collections
2374130771.introHtml:
EXPLORE

The treasures of the Louvre palace and collections

properties.html:
EXPLORE

The treasures of the Louvre palace and collections

The museum’s entire collection on one platform

The Collections database consists of entries for more than 480,000 works in the Musée du Louvre and Musée National Eugène-Delacroix. Updated on a daily basis, it is the result of the continuous research and documentation efforts carried out by teams of experts from both museums.

EXPLORE

The treasures of the Louvre palace and collections

see arms and armor pictures

3070214627.caption: Register
3070214627.introHtml:
BECOME A MEMBER

Individuals, companies or foundations

properties.html:
BECOME A MEMBER

Individuals, companies or foundations

The Amis du Louvre card
€80–€120

Enjoy the many perks of membership, including one year of free and priority admission to the permanent collections and temporary exhibitions. Become a solo cardholder (€80) or join with a friend (€120).

The Amis du Louvre card for young adults
€15–€60

If you are under 30 years old and would like to benefit from one year of free and priority admission to the permanent collections and temporary exhibitions, among other perks, this is the card for you. Become a member alone (€15 for visitors under the age of 26 and €35 for visitors under 30) or with a friend (€28 for two visitors under the age of 26 and €60 for two visitors under 30).

The Amis du Louvre family option
+€15

For an additional €15, you can add a family option at any time to your Ami du Louvre subscription (subscribers, members, benefactors) or Ami du Louvre young adult card. Share the complete programme of activities and artistic discovery at the Louvre with the children in your life.

BECOME A MEMBER

Membership Form
